snippet: A relatively minor leak last year has led regulators in Alberta to re-examine production that uses steam under pressure to separate oil from subterranean sands.
abstract: Relatively minor oil leak in 2013 is leading regulators in Alberta, Canada, to re-examine production that uses steam under pressure to separate oil from subterranean sands; Alberta Energy Regulator officials have refused to accept explanations for cause of accident by field operator Canadian Natural Resources; agency has also rejected company’s bid to restart its operation until complete investigation had been completed.
lead_paragraph: A relatively minor leak last year has led regulators in Alberta to re-examine production that uses steam under pressure to separate oil from subterranean sands.

headline.main: Accident Leads to Scrutiny of Oil Sand Production
headline.print_headline: Accident Leads to Scrutiny of Oil Sand Production
